course.subject: MATH
course.name: Numerical Analysis
course.description: Basic numerical analysis, including stability of computation, linear systems, eigenvalues and eigenvectors, nonlinear equations, interpolation and approximation, numerical integration and solution of ordinary differential equations, optimization.
course.prerequisites: (COMP 1021 / COMP 1022P / COMP 1022Q (prior to 2020-21)) AND (MATH 2111 / MATH 2121 / MATH 2131 / MATH 2350) AND (MATH 2031 / MATH 2033 / MATH 2043)
course.exclusions: MECH 4740, PHYS 3142

reviews.author: 阿賢
reviews.title: Worthwhile to study this course for grade
reviews.comment_content:
⭐ 想提前自修就上: Reference website http://www.math.ust.hk/~mamu/courses/231/hom.htm

⭐ 內容基本上圍繞 ( 2 -tions)

1. 搵solu -tions (姐係搵x = ?)，形式可以為scalar, vector, matrix
重點要搵個solution 同 true value 既error係幾多

2. 搵func -tions，用原有既data 去砌

⭐ 針對考試:
唔洗睇書，只要睇lecture notes就可以，基本上做熟題目 (舉個例子: for divided difference, assignments 入面可能只係叫你做2個data 既second divided difference, 但你要嘗試下3個data既third divided difference)
同埋背齊proof (極鍾意考proof, 背左隨時高一個sd)

因為係Online 既final exam, 所以有 pdf 檔 (附件), 我諗年年都差唔多
reviews.comment_teaching: Mo Mu 教書有心，但通常係因為口音問題唔會聽得明，所以果斷放棄上堂啦 (for my case)
reviews.comment_workload: 相比起其他math courses, workload算少，同埋assignments既題目，網上應該搵到 answer.

reviews.author: youth222
reviews.title: Excellent course, grade saver
reviews.comment_content:
The course contents are easy to handle.
P.S. I am a trash math student.
reviews.comment_teaching:
I didn't attend any lessons.
I just read the notes by myself, but the tutorial notes by Fan Ganghua are really nice. Only reading the notes and completing the examples in the notes is enough for the exam.
reviews.comment_grading:
Very good grading
Assignment: 465/500
Midterm: 85/100 (Mean: 82/100, SD: 20.44)
Final 76/100 (Mean: 78.6/100, SD:15.87)

Got B at last, I think my total score is mean / slightly below mean
reviews.comment_workload:
5 assignments throughout the semester. Easy and very similar to the examples in lecture/tutorial notes, but better triple-check about the calculations before submitting them.
For the exam, you need to remember the proofs and derivations of the formula too.

reviews.author: lironghao
reviews.title: Easy to learn. Lazy to attend.
reviews.comment_content:
Just some ordinary and basic materials on analysis. If your analysis ability is strong, say, having taken some fundamental math analysis courses before, this course is definitely a piece of delicious cake.  
(Google translation)
只是一些普通和基礎的資料而已。如果您的分析能力很強，比如說，曾經參加過一些基礎的數學分析課程，那麼這門課程絕對是一塊好蛋糕。

Root Finding (Chapter 2)
Bisection method (2.1)
Fixed-point iteration (2.2)
Newton's method, Secant method (2.3)

Interpolation (Chapter 3)
Interpolation and the Lagrange (interpolating) polynomial and the approximation error (3.1)
Divided differences and Newton's interpolatory divided-difference formula (3.2)

Numerical Differentiation and Integration (Chapter 4)
Numerical differentiation--forward, backward, and central finite differences, errors (4.1)
Elements of numerical integration (4.3)
Composite rules (4.4)

Solution of Ordinary Differential Equations (Chapter 5)
Euler's method and the approximation error (5.2)

Solving Linear Systems (Chapters 6 & 7)
Gauss elimination--multipliers, Gauss elimination, back substitution, partial pivoting (6.1 - 6.2)
LU factorization--LU, forward substitution (6.5)
Iterative methods--matrix splitting, Jacobi method, Gauss-Seidel method, SOR method (7.3-7.4)
reviews.comment_teaching:
Absent for the rest of semester after attending to the first lecture to ensure that no attendance would be recorded, so I get no right to leave any comment on professor MU's teaching.

But he deserves an A for teaching, just as the old saying goes, one good turn deserves another.

Anyway, to learn any analysis course, comprehension is vital, while the other tools and techniques are easy to handle once you get your own understanding on the theorems and topics.
reviews.comment_grading:
Absolutely good grade, though high mean.

Assessment Scheme:
Homework: 10%; Midterm Exam: 30 %; Final Exam: 60 %

My grade:
Assignments
83.4%
Midterm
99%
Final exam
92%
Total
93.24%
Grade: A
I fucked up on my final.
Two reasons:
1.exam mode sucks
MU does not want the paper to leak out. Fine. So he comes up with an approach to project the paper on the screen??? Sounds strange, right? I understand that he doesn't mean to unify everyone's speed, but that's where the problem arises, John is fast while Marry is slow, so John has to wait while Marry has to hurry. It's not fair. This mode should be optimized.
2. exam mode sucks and I am not a fast man

The mean is around 85? I preserve my estimation.
reviews.comment_workload: MU assigns homework bi-weekly. So it's easy to handle and don't be too worry.

reviews.author: Fung06
reviews.comment_content:
上面有2位朋友都好詳細咁講咗 我就唔重覆了:P

呢個COURSE啲內容算簡單 易明
最緊要記熟啲formula, 點樣derive條formula出嚟(連埋error), 同埋proof

考試啲題目幾standard 同平時做嗰啲差唔多
會考點樣derive條formula 同1-2題proof

小心啲計數同撳機!!!!!!!!!!!!
reviews.comment_teaching:
momo講野口音好重 上咗一兩堂就冇上了
佢啲powerpoint內容都係同書一樣 冇咩特別

tutorial個時間好早 所以一堂都冇上 sosad
TA整既NOTES都幾好 仲有多啲EXAMPLES

PS 買左本書可以走曬堂
reviews.comment_grading:
比想像之中好
2個方法
1. homework 10%, project 20%, midterm 20%, final 50%
2. midterm 30%, final 70%
計高分嗰個

根據grading system:
(好似唔同section會睇到唔同分 不過大致上都差唔多)
midterm mean:83
final mean:65
overall mean:75

我:
midterm:81
final:67
功課 project 滿分
overall: (scheme 1):79    (scheme 2):71

最後拎B
MATH course嚟講 above mean少少有B算係咁
reviews.comment_workload:
基本上冇咩WORKLOAD
6份功課 (係書後面啲練習嚟) 上網都搵到答案
改得幾鬆手(有啲minor mistakes都冇扣分)

3份project 上網都好易搵到啲code 跟住自己改一改
可用python/matlab/C++ 做 隨你喜歡

功課同project都唔難做 好易拎滿分
建議就好做埋佢 考試低分少少都有得拉下

reviews.author: Aloha
reviews.title: belebala
reviews.comment_content:
主要係學一堆numerical methods: bisection method, newton's method, euler method, interpolation, pivoting, LU factorization, Jacobi method
學嘅野難度頗低
reviews.comment_teaching:
教授授課時水份比較多 唔係食飽飯冇野做嘅話唔建議上
寡人只係上咗兩堂就冇再上
TA 廢廢地 tutorial上唔上冇咩關係
reviews.comment_grading:
有兩個option:
option A: 10% homework, 25% midterm, 65% final
option B: 30% midterm, 70% final
midterm: mean~71 sd~ 16
final: mean~65 sd~20
me: overall ~90%  Grade=A-
reviews.comment_workload:
workload非常細 homework 總供5份 全部書上面有 有做就滿分 而且啲題目唔難 亦唔會太麻煩
考試除咗要識用堆methods 仲會考你背proof 考試前搵書啲題目做下一兩題就ok 啲題目好死板 唔洗點用腦 仲可以將啲公式入哂落部cal機度

reviews.author: _NattU_
reviews.comment_content:
The course covers the following topics from the textbook 'Numerical Analysis' by R.L. Burden and J.D. Faires :

2.1) Bisection Method
2.2) Fixed-point Iteration
2.3) Newton's Method
3.1) Interpolation and Lagrange Polynomial
3.3) Divided Differences
4.1) Numerical Differentiation
4.3) Numerical Integration
4.4) Composite Numerical Integration
5.2) Euler's Method
6.1) Linear System of Equations (Ax=b)
6.2) Pivoting Strategies
6.5) LU factorization

The course covers basic theorems (and proofs) needed to formulate the algorithms along with computational examples. The focus is on the computation part. Students not familiar with mathematical analysis may find the proofs difficult. There is no coding involved.
reviews.comment_teaching:
I only attended a few lectures before I decided to skip the rest of them. The professor has passion but I couldn't follow along with whatever he was saying. He's always going off on tangents and most students got no clue what's going on. Fortunately, his lecture slides are self-explanatory.  It's better to self-study in my opinion.

He replies to emails quickly so that's a plus.

However, in the final, for one of the only two questions that involve analysis (Error bound theorem for Euler's method), he gave us the wrong solution formula and there was a lot of confusion. I screwed up that question and lost 6 marks. Because of this incident, I also couldn't finish another question on time and lost 4 marks there... He didn't even give us additional time for all of that commotion!! Could've been the difference between an A and an A+ :(((
reviews.comment_grading:
Course Assessment:

HW Assignments: 10%
Midterm Exam: 30%
Final Exam: 60%

          My score | Mean  (Out of 100)

HW1:   97  | 95.62
HW2:  100 | 88.37
HW3:  100 | 93.5
HW4:   85 | 86.72
HW5: 100 | 94.69

Exam scores (out of 100):

          My score | Mean | Median | Low Q | Up Q

Midterm: 100 | 86.06 | 90| 78.25 | 96
Final : 84 | 71.13 | 72.5 | 61 | 83.75

My overall score was 90.04%. I got an A.
reviews.comment_workload:
Very light workload. Only 5 HW assignments. They're all very straightforward and relatively easy but it's also easy to make simple computational mistakes.

You need to memorize a lot of formulae and error terms and should be able to replicate proofs for the exams. However, with enough practice, they should come to you naturally.

BTW買本參考書，可以乜堂都唔上，因為本身個course就好簡單，睇書就已經明佢講乜。

reviews.author: eugenedomo
reviews.title: Numerical Analysis
reviews.comment_content: Quite easy before midterm about approximation and something like taylor series. But it will become bit difficult after midterm so more time is needed torevise.
reviews.comment_teaching: No lecture notes provided as Dr.Leung writes all materials on the whiteboard. So though attendance will not be taken, regular taking of lectures is important.
reviews.comment_grading: Good grading comparing to many other Math course as above half SD in midterm and below few marks in Final gives me a B-. Homeowrk almost full marks.
reviews.comment_workload: Not much workload only a piece of homeowrk for 2 weeks. But some MATLAB techniques would be taught so students should try to learn.

reviews.author: math4999
reviews.title: In Tim Leung we trust!!
reviews.comment_content:
1. root finding (bisection, Newton's) and the analysis of each method
2. interpolation (Lagrange interpolating polynomial, Newton divided difference)
3. numerical differentiation and integration
4. numerical linear algebra
5. approximation
6. numerical ODE
教既野比毛毛多，但係唔會覺得chur
reviews.comment_teaching: Tim Leung 教書非常好，條理分明同有足夠既example。上佢堂會學到野，比之前教呢科果位好得多。相信之後都會係佢教因為呢科野既content會係之後既MATH4999用番，特別係numerical ODE果part。
reviews.comment_workload: 有7份功課，主要有兩種題目theoretical 同computational。theoretical 係一d proof同類似書既題目。computational係要用matlab去寫d program 去計d野。computation既題目係想d人早d知道點用matlab，因為math4999全部野都係用matlab做。

reviews.author: UnconMarketeers
reviews.title: Might not be as good as before for grades?
reviews.comment_content:
1. Official textbook: Lecture slide from the instructor's course webpage. The true textbook is not necessary for the course.

2. Course content. Let me put some summary on this course first:

i. Many numerical iteration algorithms are covered in courses like MATH1024 (FF's version, for numerical integration) and MATH5285 (for many other algorithms), and these courses teach the related content using a few lectures.
ii. In overall, the course teaches algorithms for "classical stuff" like root-finding, numerical differentiation/integration, and solution to system of equation.

========Part One: Contraction mapping theorem=======

-> Essentially the same as the first part of MATH5285 (Except advanced algorithm like Gauss-Seidel which are put in last part). If interested, please look at my review for MATH5285.

=========Part Two: Lagrange polynomial===========

-> Theoretical basis: Weierstrauss approximation theorem (For any continuous function defined on compact interval, there is polynomial uniformly approximating the function)
-> Construction of polynomial: Lagrange interpolation

==========Part Three: Numerical differentiation===========

-> Algorithms are deduced by either Lagrange polynomial, or by Taylor series.
-> Forward/backward difference (Lagrange poly. of order 1)
-> Three-point method (Lagrange poly. of order 2)
-> Three-point second derivative (Taylor series, order 4). This is essential because one step for deriving the Simpson's rule does require this.

===========Part Three: Numerical integration===========

-> Trapezoidal rule (Lagrange polynomial, order 1)
-> Simpson's rule (Taylor series, order 4)
-> Midpoint rule (Taylor series, order 2)

========Part Four: Solving ODE======

-> The only algorithm taught is the Euler's forward difference method. It is derived by Taylor series again.
-> However, the derivation for error bound of this algorithm is relatively difficult in this course. Make sure you understand, say find the Lipschitz constant for Lipschitz continuous function.

========Part Five: System of equation========

-> LU Decomposition (Factorize square matrix by a lower triangular and upper triangular matrix)
-> Jacobi's method, Gauss-Seidel, SOR...
reviews.comment_teaching: The instructor is good at "water-blowing"... He is able to speak a lot of unnecessary stuff in every lecture, so that I guess less than half of the lecture time is really for lecturing. So self-learning this course is more efficient, in terms of time management and learning efficiency.
reviews.comment_grading:
10% Homework, 30% Midterm, 60% Final.

Be careful! The mean of midterm in this semester is surprisingly high (~87, as shown in canvas), and upper quartile is 96! There might be ~15% of candidates getting full mark in midterm.
reviews.comment_workload:
One homework per chapter (5 in total). Although the number of homework problems is very small, I have to make the following complaint for homework:

1. the frequency for the release of homework is a bit weird. Say, the first homework releases in early October, and the last 3 homework are released frequently in mid-late November.

2. The efficiency of grade release for homework is ridiculously slow. After final exam, I still don't know the grade for the last two homework.

For final, make sure you know how to derive algorithms and their error bounds. If you are familiar with analysis, then spending one or two days for revision is fine. Speaking of final, this year's final is roughly similar to the past exam released on the internet, except that the advanced algorithms in last part are examined. The most absurd thing is that, many amendments are made during exam, but no extra time is added due to those annoying changes.

reviews.author: KarlYAu
reviews.title: Easy Math course
reviews.comment_content:
This course presents numerical methods for solving mathematical problems. It deals with the theory and application of numerical approximation techniques as well as their computer implementation. It covers computer arithmetic, solution of nonlinear equations, interpolation and approximation, numerical integration and differentiation, solution of differential equations, and matrix computation.

Course Topics:

Preliminaries

Roundoff Errors and Computer Arithmetic, Significant digits (1.2)
Programming with Numerical Methods (e.g. Matlab (Links to an external site.))
Root Finding (Chapter 2)

Bisection methodLinks to an external site. (2.1)
Fixed-pointLinks to an external site. iterationLinks to an external site. (2.2)
Newton's methodLinks to an external site., Secant methodLinks to an external site. (2.3)
Interpolation (Chapter 3)

Interpolation and the Lagrange (interpolating) polynomialLinks to an external site. and the approximation errorLinks to an external site. (3.1)
Divided differences and Newton's interpolatory divided-difference formulaLinks to an external site. (3.2)
Numerical Differentiation and Integration (Chapter 4)

Numerical differentiation--forward, backwardLinks to an external site., and central finite differences, errorsLinks to an external site. (4.1)
Elements of numerical integrationLinks to an external site. (4.3)
Composite rulesLinks to an external site. (4.4)
Solution of Ordinary Differential Equations (Chapter 5)

Euler's methodLinks to an external site. and the approximation errorLinks to an external site. (5.2)
Solving Linear Systems (Chapters 6 & 7)

Gauss elimination--multipliers, Gauss elimination, back substitutionLinks to an external site., partial pivotingLinks to an external site. (6.1 - 6.2)
LU factorization--LU, forward substitutionLinks to an external site. (6.5)
Iterative methods--matrix splitting, Jacobi methodLinks to an external site., Gauss-Seidel methodLinks to an external site., SOR methodLinks to an external site. (7.3-7.4)
reviews.comment_teaching: 同所有MATH course基本所有堂都可以走，完左MT之後唔見左大半班。台灣人英文重叫聽得明，但都好難頂。
reviews.comment_grading:
math 入面都真係叫做靚grade,只要有温書都可以輕鬆B range自問自己都幾hea下去上堂都係hea。

Homework: 10%; Midterm Exam: 30 %; Final Exam: 60 %

Assignment-1 85/100
Assignment-2 80/100
Assignment-3 100/100
Assignment-4 90/100
Assignment-5 50/100

mid term:74/100

Final exam:81/100

Overall:78.9/100 (B)
reviews.comment_workload: quite easy to get B range if u pay hard in final and MT, is not diffcult to get A range

reviews.author: 2000li
reviews.title: Easiest MATH course in hkust
reviews.comment_content:
Only 5 chapters (6 original) consist in this semester.

1. Root Finding
- bisection method, newtons method, secant method

2. Interpolation & Polynomial Approximation
- lagrange polynomial, divided difference

3. Numerical Differentiation and Integration
- three/five-point endpoint formula, second derivative mid-point formula, trapezoidal rule, simpson's rule, ...

4. IVP for ODE
- Euler's method

5. Direct Methods for Solving Linear Systems
- gaussian elimination, LU factorization

Details can be found in Mu Mo's website.
reviews.comment_teaching:
I did not attend the lectures so I cannot comment on it.
Personally think reading the lecture notes by yourself is enough.
reviews.comment_grading:
The grading is super good. Final grades are determined based on the curve of total marks using a mixed relative and absolute scheme.

midterm
mean: 90/100
sd: 7.07

final
mean: 86/100
sd: 12.6

For me:
homework overall 494/500
midterm 93/100 +0.43sd
final 94/100 +0.48sd

I expected it will be a B+ but finally scored A. Thank you Mu Mo.
My friend scored mean in final and mid term, hw got full = A-
It is very good among MATH courses
reviews.comment_workload:
Extremely low workload.
Only 5 assignments during the semester. All assignments are easy and straight forward so each of them can finished within one hour or less. You can google the solution so you can check your work after you finished.
For midterm and final, the format is just like homework so you do not need to study too much if you did your homework seriously. The only workload is memorizing the proofs and formulae.

reviews.author: YS
reviews.title: 唉梁sir我無乜天份學唔好呢個course
reviews.comment_content:
估 乜春都係估
root finding
polynomial interpolation
differentiation & integration
linear system
least square
ODE
唔係難但係me覺得多
reviews.comment_teaching:
梁Sir有心教 但係
唔用notes
即場講
係有啲1999 (覺得睇住書間中上次堂夠做)
me中後期開始要用參考書搭救

關TA就照notes讀無乜特別
reviews.comment_grading:
算係咁啦 唉
樣樣野都above mean少少咪B囉

hw 15% mt 30% final 55% or
hw 15% mt 0% final 85%
best of either
reviews.comment_workload:
幾大 雖然得6份hw 但係一份難過一份
